name: Limit Definition of Derivative
statement: The derivative of f at x is defined as the limit of the difference quotient.
philosophy: Captures instantaneous rate of change via infinitesimal differences.

name: Linearity of Derivatives
statement: The derivative of a sum or scalar multiple distributes: (af + bg)' = af' + bg'.

name: Product Rule
statement: The derivative of a product is (fg)' = f'g + fg'.
philosophy: Differentiation involves both functions' growth simultaneously.

name: Quotient Rule
statement: The derivative of a quotient is (f/g)' = (f'g − fg') / g².
philosophy: Change rate of ratios involves both numerator and denominator rates.

name: Chain Rule
statement: The derivative of a composition is (f∘g)'(x) = f'(g(x))·g'(x).
philosophy: Composite change requires inner and outer change chained.

name: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus (Part 1)
statement: If F is the antiderivative of f, then ∫ₐᵇ f(x) dx = F(b) − F(a).
formal: ∫ₐᵇ f(x) dx = F(b) − F(a), where F' = f

name: Power Rule (Differentiation)
statement: The derivative of xⁿ is nxⁿ⁻¹ for any real n.
philosophy: General rule for polynomial and real powers.
